item.title: Untaxed vehicle, 31st July
item.description:
This untaxed vehicle is parked in a single yellow line and it’s partially blocking my driveway. I have asked neighbours and nobody knows this car. I would like to get removed as is preventing me to freely leave with my vehicle. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Parkview Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Unknown bin dumped outside flat, 31st July
item.description:

item.title: Black Greenwich Council waste bin has been dumped on footpath between Kemsing Road SE10 0LL and Halstow Road., 31st July
item.description:
A black waste bin.belonging to Greenwich Council has been dumped on the footpath between Kemsing Road and Halstow Road near the school. It is half full with cardboard and other waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Kemsing Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface badly damaged, 31st July
item.description:
A delivery lorry was in the road for about an hour and some liquid (unknown) was spilt on the road surface. The person who had the delivery scattered sand or cement on the liquid - but the road surface may be damaged!!! This road was only re-surfaced last year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Stafford Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal bin full of poo, 31st July
item.description:
Someone has left a metal pedal bin overflowing with, what appears to be, carrier bags of poo. It is blocking the pavement between 20 and 24 West street
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, West Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 inch pothole on grass verge outside bike hangar, 31st July
item.description:
The pothole has been here for at least 9 months and although not on the pavement, it does feel a risk for those making use of the bike hangar as it can be hard to gain access and manoeuvre the bike around the hole. I’d be very glad if this could be filled with soil to prevent further risk. This is located directly outside the bike hangar on the corner of Chipstead close and Belvedere Road. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belvedere Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
